meanings.definition: A marine worm that burrows in sand or mud and is used as bait for fishing.
meanings.sent1: I saw a lugworm wriggling in the sand at the beach.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen use lugworms to catch fish in the ocean.
meanings.sent3: The lugworm decided to take a vacation from the sea and try out life on land.
meanings.sent4: The lugworm's burrow in the sand was like a secret tunnel to another world.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the lugworm's ability to disappear into the sand.

meanings.definition: To carry or drag something heavy or awkward.
meanings.sent1: I had to lugworm the heavy box up the stairs to my room.
meanings.sent2: The movers had to lugworm the piano carefully out of the house.
meanings.sent3: He lugwormed the giant teddy bear across the room, pretending it was a real bear.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had to lugworm the weight of the world on her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The team had to lugworm the equipment through the muddy field to reach the campsite.
